Race.SpecificTitle: PW School Board -- 9.52 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  Authority for Calcasieu Parish School Board to continue to levy and collect a 10-year special tax of Nine and Fifty-Two One-Hundredths (9.52) Mills, with collections from the levy of the tax estimated to be $14,076,530 for one entire year, to provide additional support for maintenance and operation of the public schools of Calcasieu Parish.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish School Board of the Parish of Calcasieu, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article 8, Section 13(C)(Third) of the Constitution of 1974 of the State of Louisiana, La. R.S. 39:701, et seq., and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, continue to levy and collect each year for a period of ten years beginning January 1, 2013, a special tax of Nine and Fifty-Two One-Hundredths (9.52) Mills on the dollar of all property subject to taxation in the Parish of Calcasieu, Louisiana, with collections from  the levy of the tax estimated to be $14,076,530 for one entire year for the purpose of providing additional support for maintenance and operation of the public schools of Calcasieu Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Sales Tax Dist. #2 -- 1/2% S&U Tax - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Sales Tax District No. Two)
(Sales Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10-year 1/2% sales and use tax ("Tax") with collections from the tax estimated to be $20,500,000 for one entire year, to offset losses of revenues from the State of Louisiana, and/or supplementing other revenues available to the District.
Race.FullText: Shall Sales Tax District No. Two of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, under the provisions of Article 6, Section 29 of the Constitution of 1974 of the State of Louisiana, La. R.S. 33:2721.6, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, extend for a period of ten years beginning January 1, 2013, and be authorized to continue to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, a tax of one-half of one percent (1/2 of 1%), with collections from the tax estimated to be $20,500,000 for one entire year, currently being collected upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption and storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property and on sales of services in Sales Tax District No. Two of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, all presently or hereafter defined in La. R.S. 47:301 through La. R.S. 47:317, with the proceeds of the tax to be dedicated exclusively for offsetting losses of revenues from the State of Louisiana, and/or supplementing other revenues available to the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Chennault Int. Airport Auth. -- 5.45 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Chennault International Airport Authority)
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  Authorization for the Chennault International Airport Authority to seek renewal of a tax of five and forty-five hundredths (5.45) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation for a period of ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2016, with collections from the levy of the tax estimated to be $7,663,655 for one entire year, for industrial, commercial, and economic development purposes.
Race.FullText: Shall the Chennault International Airport Authority continue to levy and collect a tax not to exceed five and forty-five hundredths (5.45) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation in the Parish of Calcasieu, State of Louisiana, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning January 1, 2016, and ending December 31, 2025, with collections from the levy of the tax estimated to be $7,663,655 for one entire year, for industrial, commercial, and economic development purposes within the District (Calcasieu Parish), including the purpose of paying the cost of maintaining, operating, relocating, constructing, or improving industrial properties or airport facilities of the Chennault International Airport Authority constituting works of permanent public improvement, title to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: School Dist. No. 28 -- 9.87 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
School District No. 28 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  Authority for School District No. 28 of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, to continue to levy and collect a 10-year special tax of nine and eighty-seven one-hundredths (9.87) mills in addition to other taxes levied by the District, with collections from the levy of the tax estimated to be $140,500 for one entire year, for acquiring, maintaining and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within the District.
Race.FullText: Shall School District No. 28 of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, continue to levy and collect a special tax of nine and eighty-seven one-hundredths (9.87) mills for a period of ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2013, in excess of and in addition to other taxes levied by the District, with collections from the levy of the tax estimated to be $140,500 for one entire year, for the purpose of acquiring, maintaining and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, purchasing, erecting, enlarging and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for said School District, and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: Waterworks Dist. #9 of Wd. 4 -- 3 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Waterworks District No. Nine of Ward Four Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of three (3) mill ad valorem property tax for the Waterworks District No. Nine of Ward Four running from January 1, 2013 to December 31, 2022 for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating the Districts waterworks system. The District expects to collect $404,107.00 from said tax in 2013.
Race.FullText: Shall Waterworks District No. Nine of Ward Four of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to renew, levy and collect an ad valorem property tax of three (3) mills on all the property subject to taxation within the District for a period of ten (10) years beginning on January 1, 2013 and ending December 31, 2022, for the purposes of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating the Districts waterworks system?  The District estimates that it will collect $404,107.00 from the levy of the tax in the year 2013.
